questionListItems.title: How do I cancel or delete my earlier SG Arrival Card (SGAC) if I submit a new SGAC?

answer.body: You are not required to cancel or delete your declarations. If there is any change to your earlier submitted SG Arrival Card, you will need to resubmit a new SG Arrival Card with the updated information. The earlier submission will be superseded by the new declaration.

topics.title: SG Arrival Card (SGAC) and Electronic Visit Pass (e-Pass)

parentTopic.title: SG Arrival Card (SGAC) and Electronic Visit Pass (e-Pass)

questionListItems.title: When should I submit or apply for the SG Arrival Card (SGAC) with Electronic Health Declaration?

answer.body:
Arriving travellers can submit their personal information, trip details and health declaration through the SG Arrival Card e-Service at the ICA website or via MyICA mobile app within three days prior to the date of their arrival in Singapore.
 
For example, travellers arriving in Singapore on 30 June 2023 can only submit their declaration from 28 June 2023 onwards.

This means that they will only need to produce their passports for immigration clearance upon arrival, as ICA's immigration system will already have the electronic arrival cards which they submitted in advance.
 
The above does not apply to those who are transiting or transferring through Singapore without seeking immigration clearance; or Residents (Singapore citizens, Permanent Residents, Long-Term Pass holders*) entering via Land Checkpoints.


*Long-Term Pass holders include holders of Student's Pass, Dependant's Pass, Long-Term Visit Pass and Work Pass.

topics.title: SG Arrival Card (SGAC) and Electronic Visit Pass (e-Pass)

parentTopic.title: SG Arrival Card (SGAC) and Electronic Visit Pass (e-Pass)

questionListItems.title: Can PRs still travel with a passport which is expiring in 6 months' time or less?

answer.body:
Generally, as long as a Permanent Resident (PR)’s Re-Entry Permit (REP) remains valid, he/she is able to use his/her current valid passport for immigration clearance at the Singapore checkpoints.

A valid REP is necessary to facilitate a Singapore PR’s travel. It will also enable him/her to retain his/her PR status while away from Singapore and return as a PR. A PR who remains outside Singapore without a valid REP will lose his/her PR status.

However, they are advised to be mindful of the immigration requirements of any country they wish to depart, visit or place of return when travelling on a passport that is less than six months valid before embarking on their journey. Where applicable, they should also check with the airline to ensure that they are allowed to board the plane as airlines have the prerogative to issue boarding passes to their passengers.

As Singapore’s border measures and entry requirements will evolve as the global situation changes, please visit the MOH website and ICA website for the latest updates on travel and health control measures.

It is important for a Singapore PR to renew his/her foreign passport if it is expiring. Ensuring that a passport remains valid will allow ICA to determine his/her foreign citizenship.

For all matters relating to foreign passport, please approach the respective Embassy/Consulate/Overseas Mission in Singapore.

Once a new passport is obtained, PRs will need to transfer their valid REPs to their new passports online via the e-Service using their Singpass. Parents of minor PRs, who are Singapore citizen/PR, may log in to the e-Service with their Singpass.

There is no fee for the transfer of REP. Upon successful transfer, PRs can print their new REPs for reference and travel needs.

For more information on transfer of REP, please visit the ICA’s website.

questionListItems.title: How do I submit the SG Arrival Card (SGAC)?

answer.body:
You may submit your SG Arrival Card via the SG Arrival Card e-Service or via the 'MyICA’ mobile application. The mobile application can be downloaded for free from the App Store (iOS) or Google Play (Android).

You can refer to SG Arrival Card for more information.

topics.title: SG Arrival Card (SGAC) and Electronic Visit Pass (e-Pass)

parentTopic.title: SG Arrival Card (SGAC) and Electronic Visit Pass (e-Pass)

questionListItems.title: What is a Foreign Identification Number (FIN) or FIN card?

answer.body: A Foreign Identification Number (FIN) is a unique 9-character alphanumeric serial code assigned to foreigners with Long-Term immigration passes in Singapore (e.g. Student's Pass, Long-Term Visit Pass, Employment Pass, Work Permit, etc.) issued by the Immigration & Checkpoints Authority (ICA) or the Ministry of Manpower (MOM). This FIN is not replicated.

questionListItems.title: How do I extend my Short-Term Visit Pass (STVP) or stay in Singapore?

answer.body:
All short-term visit pass (STVP) extension applications must be submitted online via the e-Service. Walk-in applications will not be accepted. You are advised to submit your application up to 14 days before the expiry of your current short-term visit pass (STVP). Your application will be processed within three working days.

You may generally apply to extend your stay for 30 days from your date of entry into Singapore; or 89 days from your date of entry into Singapore if you are an immediate family member (i.e. spouse, parents, children and siblings) of Singapore citizen or Singapore permanent resident.

Do note that all applications will be assessed holistically and are subjected to approval.

questionListItems.title: Can I download the updated copy of the SG Arrival Card (SGAC)?

answer.body: If you are using the SG Arrival Card e-Service, you may download a PDF copy of the SG Arrival Card upon updating your SG Arrival Card record. If you are using the MyICA Mobile App, your updated SG Arrival Card record can be viewed under 'Individual Submission' or 'Group Submission'. Please be informed that all updated SG Arrival Card information will be stored in ICA's system.

topics.title: SG Arrival Card (SGAC) and Electronic Visit Pass (e-Pass)

parentTopic.title: SG Arrival Card (SGAC) and Electronic Visit Pass (e-Pass)

questionListItems.title: How do I appeal against my visa rejection?

answer.body:
You can submit an appeal within one month from the date of visa rejection to ICA_SAVE_Helpdesk@ica.gov.sg.

Please include the following documents in your email for us to process your appeal:

  • A copy of applicant's passport biodata page;
  • A letter (signed by the local contact) to request ICA to reconsider applicant's visa rejection and reason for reconsideration; 
  • Any other supporting documents
  • The local contact’s NRIC date of issue for the facilitation of the appeal.

The processing time for appeal is generally 14 working days, depending on its complexity. Each appeal is assessed and considered on its own merits.

Local contacts are advised to monitor the status of the visa appeal online via the Enquire Application Status function.

questionListItems.title: How can I contact ICA for citizenship matters?

answer.body: If you have enquiries regarding Singapore citizenship, you may email us at ICA_Citizenship_Unit@ica.gov.sg or call us at 6391 6324.

questionListItems.title: Are there issues if I did not submit the SG Arrival Card (SGAC) before arriving to Singapore?

answer.body: Travellers are strongly encouraged to submit their SG Arrival Card before arriving in Singapore, as those who have not done so will be required to submit on arrival before they can proceed for immigration clearance. This will delay their immigration clearance unnecessarily.

topics.title: SG Arrival Card (SGAC) and Electronic Visit Pass (e-Pass)

parentTopic.title: SG Arrival Card (SGAC) and Electronic Visit Pass (e-Pass)

questionListItems.title: How do I apply for or replace an Identity Card (IC) if I have lost my IC?

answer.body:
The Identity Card is an important national identification document. In the wrong hands, it can be used for illegal purposes. Therefore, it is important for the holder to report the loss to ICA. The IC holder is required by law to report the loss to ICA within 14 days.

The replacement fee for a lost Identity Card will apply. The replacement fee is $100 for first loss of NRIC and $300 for second and subsequent losses.

For more details on documents required and processing time, you may visit ICA website on Loss of Identity Card.

questionListItems.title: How do I renounce my Singapore Permanent Residence (PR) status?

answer.body:
Advisory on renunciation of PR

If the main applicant intends to renounce the permanent residence status, all the dependants who obtained the permanent residence status under the sponsorship are also required to renounce together with the same procedure.


NS-liable Permanent Residents (PRs) are expected to serve National Service (NS).

Renouncing or losing one's PR status without serving or completing full-time NS will have a serious adverse impact on applications to work or study in Singapore, or for any long-term immigration facilities in Singapore, whether now or in the future. Renouncing or losing one’s PR status without serving or completing full-time NS will also adversely affect your family members’ applications for long-term immigration facilities, their ability to sponsor such facilities, their renewal of Re-Entry Permits, or their applications for Singapore citizenship.

If you still wish to proceed with the renunciation of your PR, you may submit the application online.

Please refer to ICA website for further information on the documents requirement to renounce PR.

Should you decide to renounce your PR status, you are also advised to liaise with your employer and the Central Provident Fund Board (CPFB) on your CPF matters. You can contact CPFB for further information and assistance.

questionListItems.title: How can I update my information if there are changes to the submitted details on SG Arrival Card (SGAC)?

answer.body:
You can update your arrival information in the SG Arrrival Card e-service via 'Update a Submission', provided the record has not expired. Please note that the arrival information you have submitted for each trip will expire:-
i) after the date of the arrival; or
ii) after you have made your trip, whichever is earlier.

If you are using MyICA Mobile App, you can update your arrival information, provided the record has not expired, by navigating to your trip record and select the 'Edit' button to make the changes. You can tap on the 'Submit' button after making the amendments.

topics.title: SG Arrival Card (SGAC) and Electronic Visit Pass (e-Pass)

parentTopic.title: SG Arrival Card (SGAC) and Electronic Visit Pass (e-Pass)

questionListItems.title: Does the Singapore Permanent Residence (PR) status expires?

answer.body: The Singapore PR status will not expire. However, a valid Re-Entry Permit (REP) is needed each time a Singapore PR travels abroad. The REP allows you to retain your Singapore PR status while you are outside of Singapore. If you leave Singapore or remain overseas without a valid REP, you will lose your Singapore PR status. You must login to ICA e-Service using your Singpass to renew your REP.

questionListItems.title: What should I do if I lost my IC?

answer.body:
The IC is an important national identification document. It can be used for illegal purposes if in the wrong hands. It is important and required by law for the IC holder to report the loss of IC at ICA e-Service within 14 days.

You can refer to ICA website on Loss of Identity Card for more information.

The replacement fee of $100 for first loss of NRIC and $300 for second and subsequent losses will apply.
